page.title: 14TRANSPORT AROUND HOWNAM
page.content: There is no public transport in the area round Hownam in the Scottish Borders, so between the 12 resident families there are 17 cars, 4 land- rovers and 1 motorbike, and all but 4 of the adults can drive.Providing your own transport is essential for larger items of shopping,though the community is well served for every-day needs.The Post Office at Hownam sells crisps,lemonade and cigarettes,and throughout the week a baker,fishmonger butcher and grocer call at all the houses.Milk is delivered for those who require it,as although only 1 milk cow is now kept in the area,goats are becoming more popular, and 6 are at present being used for milk.There is now no school at Hownam,and of the 10 children,2 go to boarding school,and the rest travel daily 4 or 11 miles by school bus to receive education.
